page.title: 12Farming
page.content: Once an area of mixed farming, this is now an essentially arable land, growing wheat, barley, oats, rape and beans. There is some grazing of beef cattle and a very few sheep and intensively reared cattle but no dairy herds. There is one turkey farm in Walkern and a pig farm in Ardeley. Over one third of the land forms part of the estate of a Walkern family while about a quarter belongs to one other farm. The remainder is divided between about 7 farmers. Few people now work the land: on one farm, 6 cope with about 770 acres and on another one worker has replaced 6. A major worry is cereal overproduction with government stockpiling and it is thought that a quota system may eventually have to be considered. The EEC is viewed ambivalently.
